Reviews.Title: “Far from city center!”
Reviews.Author: Soheill
Reviews.Content: Well, a travel agency suggested this hotel for me, small hotel far from barcelona's main attractions!, 10 min from metro station and 6 min from bus stop. The neighboorhood seems quiet and you may feel a little bit unsecure if you come back to hotel late around midnight!! Rooms are big and clean, however the water was not draining in bath tub and basin properly! There was not enough towels in the bathroom. No sleepers were provided even on demand! Hotel seems very quiet and kind of understaffed! Though the staff are kind, bilingual and helpful. I think with this price you can find a similar hotel at least near city center ( placa caralunya)!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheKennedysClitheroe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights recently and I have to say we were rather impressed. The staff are very helpful and the hotel itself is spotlessly clean. We liked the modern and minimalistic styling of the rooms. For people who like to be 'in the centre of things', this hotel might seem a little out of the way, but as many other reviews have said, it is only a short journey down to town via taxi or metro. At the advice of the hotel we each bought a T10 ticket (train/metro) which allowed us each 10 journeys. This was fantastic value at under 10 euros each. On another note, our internet connection was the best that we have experienced - and free!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Dancer1811
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault this stay at all... Rooms are amazing and staff are really friendly. It's about an hour walk into town centre but it's a really pleasant walk where you can see sights along the way. If you don't like walking it's only 12 euros in a taxi also metro stop 2 mins from hotel. Lovely sushi takeaway nearby and cafes perfect for breakfast and lunch. Would 100% stay here again! It's also only about 15 mins roughly depending on traffic away from barcelona airport!! Perfect way to see barcelona in SUPERB comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for 47 euros”
Reviews.Author: LondonHolidaybuff
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here one night and found the staff, reception, food and price unlievably good. Clean bed great bathroom in Sierra 2k from centre with loads of busses and metro nearby. Great stair ants 1block either way and I mean great good food good price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: AlexPBLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a bit of a frustrating 3 night stay here. The hotel is woefully understaffed. Asking anything of reception is pointless as they don't have a clue. Wifi only works in reception and is a bit piece unsecured network. According to the girl on reception it was our 2 iPhones and laptops that were to blame! The rooms smell of stale smoke as they are interlinked by the same ventilation system. If you are a non-smoker I strongly advise you don't stay here as you will smell like a 60 a dayer after one night. The man on reception told us it was impossible that the room could smell of cigarettes as if we were having him on. Terrible customer service. Whilst the area is safe the hotel doesn't feel secure. There was only one person working in the hotel after midnight and he was away from reception delivering room service. Fire doors onto the street remain permanently open to any passer by. It may not be central London where I come from but they're very trusting I'll give them that. The rooms exclude some bizarre amenities. For example there's nowhere to throw rubbish away, leave it out and the cleaner will leave it too! Don't bother with the TV as its mainly static! Furniture has seen better days, needs some investment to get it back up to standard. I obviously had much higher expectations with regards the price and star rating. We would not stay here again and I can't imagine it will be a 4 star when its reviewed again as its incomparable to other similar hotels we've stayed in in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel-fantastic staff!!”
Reviews.Author: 189400George
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC hotel,very friendly,english spoken, and helpful staff!!The hotel is not very far from the centre(10-12 minutes by train-''Ferocarils''-and 4-5 minutes walking) and the area is lovely,rich and safe. The hotel is awesome!Fresh,clean,modern and the bed is just perfect!Nearby there is a super market,shops,restaurants,and a beautiful cafe-pastry house for excellent and rather cheap breakfast.Moreover just outside the hotel,there is a bus station and you can get to many central places comfortably.The hotel looks exactly like you see on the pictures(even greater) and we really enjoyed our time there!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and I'd come here again”
Reviews.Author: BygoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Some of the other reviews are commenting on how much the standard here has dropped, particularly the fixtures and fitting in the rooms. I can't say I've found the same, not this time and not when I was here last in April 2011. Wifi has been fine, no issue to download a movie from iTunes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there!”
Reviews.Author: mel_azevedo
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Eurostar Angli and we absolutely loved it. The hotel is clean, stylish, quiet, and well maintained.The staff is super friendly and helpful. Most of them spoke Spanish, English and French. We did not try the restaurant because it was closed during the month of August, but everything else about the hotel was awesome. The hotel looks exactly like what you see on the pictures. The bed is so big that you could fit 3 people in it, and there'd still be some space between each person. The metro (Sarria) is nearby. It doesn't take you more than 10 minutes to get there, and it takes you straight to Placa Catalunya within 15 minutes. There is a couple of restaurants around the hotel, but if you are on the younger side (like us), you don't really care because you'll always be in the center of Barcelona. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: katie-likes-holidays
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are modern, but without feeling cheap, and there is none of that 'fashion over function' stuff that makes it hard to work out how to switch the lights on! Breakfast was great- fresh juices, fruit, cereal, breads, pastries, ham, cheese etc- a really good selection. The swimming pool gets the sun all day and there were plenty of sunbeds. Location-wise, the hotel is in Sarria, which is about 3 stops from plaza catalunya on the metro. The positive side of this, is that you are in a MUCH quieter area for sleeping, and you get a lot more hotel for your money. I know Barcelona very well, and some of my favourite restaurants are within a 10-15 min walk from here, so there is really no need to go into town every evening for the tourist rip off places! Check out these for dinner- La Burg (gourmet burgers in sarria) Vivanda (spanish/catalan in sarria) Tram Tram (posh spanish catalan in sarria) Gouthier (specialises in oysters but loads more tapas, in sarria) Dos Torres (spanish, halfway between sarria + tres torres) Acontraluz (spanish, as above) Hope this helps- and if you want a great late bar/ club to go to, Elephant is great. Amazing terrace, gets busy from 11.30...

Reviews.Title: “Ultramodern hotel a bit far from the action”
Reviews.Author: Narcolepsy
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, ultramodern hotel on a reasonably quiet street. The hotel is firmly in the hospital and clinic region of Barcelona and one imagines that visitors and patients make up the bulk of the clientele. The room was bright and clean with a good view up the mountain. The bathroom was so busy being trendy it lost a little usefulness (flat sink that drained very poorly - very awkward to shave in; shower head slowly traveled downwards during a shower; no bath). The location is a drawback. There is a good bakery a block and a half away and a nice Tapas place (50 Pino) two blocks away - but otherwise choices for lunch and dinner are limited (the French restaurant 2 blocks away (St Remy) looks pricey and pretentious so we didn't try it). The subway is about a ten minute walk (quite steeply uphill on the way back). The stop (Sarria) connects to the Placa de Catalonia in about 20 mins. We found this fine to go to the tourist centre in the day but a pain to go in for food in the evening. In all a good hotel if you have reason to need to be in that area - but not for the average tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms but slow service”
Reviews.Author: Caterham101
Reviews.Content: It is a very stylish hotel and the rooms are spacious with good quality fittings. The aircon was good and bed comfortable. Only issue was the service that was very slow. There seemed to be only one person covering the bar and reception. Overal a nice hotel but not the right location to enjoy the main sites. This is a good hotel for the university/school.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: SL-JR
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the quality of this hotel, given the rate we were paying for it. The staff on reception were very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms was very impressive with a floor to ceiling picture window. The room design was tastefully modern and had an array of useful features such as the ability to control the blinds from the bedside. We only had one breakfast there and it was OK - standard fare and nothing spectacular. The food delivered by room service was excellent, very fresh and tasty. However, it did seem to take an awful long time to arrive on the two occasions we had it. For us the location was great, reasonably near the metro and some good looking places to eat within walking distance. Although we were caught out - again - by the fact that restaurants don't seem to open much before 9am. The staff were the real highlight of this place - I can't rate them highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel when we stayed 2 years ago, falling to bits now!”
Reviews.Author: RichLasPalmas
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with this cool, ultra modern hotel 2/3 years ago on our first stay so decided to return again. What a shame, the place is falling to bits and we were moved room 4 times until we found aa acceptable room. The new manager was great and did her best to satisfy us with an upgrade for a night to the suite which is lovely and champagne etc. Despite this we were dissapointed, water leaks out of the showers on the floor in one of the rooms there was a problem with the wooden floor which was dangerous, telephones missing off the walls, lights that didnt work, holes in blinds, algi floating around in the pool, the list goes on, lots of small things but far too many for a hotel of this standard. We won´t be going back, which is a shame as we always remembered this hotel so fondly.

Reviews.Title: “Dandy at the Angli”
Reviews.Author: dodger23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the centre of Barcelona. It is in the Zona Alta, on the hill on the way up to Tibidabo. It is a short walk (600m) from the nearest train station at Serria; which will take you into Placa Catalunya in about 15 minutes. It is next door to a nunnery, and opposite a church; and is in a quiet neighbourhood. The aforementioned train runs close by but didn't disturb us unduly. It is part of the Eurostars chain, and is very clean and well run. The rooms (and indeed the overall design) are Starck-influenced modern. We had room 303 on the third floor, which was reasonably spacious, with a very comfy bed. Breakfast is a very decent sized buffet; which was included in our room rate. There is a swimming pool and sun terrace which we didn't use. If you don't want the noise of Las Ramblas, this is a reasonably priced, out of the way alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in decay. Not really 4 star material.”
Reviews.Author: caipirina
Reviews.Content: I kinda liked this place and the reception staff was very helpful, although they seemed a bit overwhelmed at times by people complaining that the wi-fi or this & that was not working. (Wi-Fi was out 2 of the 4 nights we stayed, and this wyfly.net thing is just annoying, kicks you out every now and then) This hotel is not well maintained. You find gapping holes in the bathroom ceiling (#113) [which means when someone showered above, we got their leftover water], missing shower doors(#114), neon lights in the hallway with hanging covers. This must have been a glorious place in its day ... now? not so much. I still liked it for the pool, the price, the big bed, the wi-fi (when it worked) and the reception staff. The location is a bit iffy. Great when you are on your own, just a 5 minutes walk to the subway. With family its a bit more tricky. There is not much out there for food (Bar Tomas is famous for their Patatas Bravas, and then there is also a Dominos) Parking at 16€ a day is steep. We managed to find roadside parking and saved 64€.

Reviews.Title: “Good value modern design hotel - quite far out though”
Reviews.Author: catread99
Reviews.Content: This was nice looking modern hotel with some great design features, some a little odd perhaps. Great price, though this reflected the location far out of the city centre. The metro stop is a five minutes walk away (a little up hill on way home) and nearest restaurants about the same, though the majority are 10/15 minute walk away in Sarria centre. In the north area of the city in the foothills quite close to Gracia district to the south and Tibidabo (all by metro though). Take a walk to Sarria centre, was all closed up for Easter when we were there but looked like some nice local places to eat. Great value and an excellent choice if you want a modern design hotel without the Barcelona prices - but not in the thick of things if that is what you want. We didn't go for hotel breakfast so don't know about that, but there is a little cafe on the corner nearby serving good coffee and pastries (about 10 euro for 2 people). The St Remy restaurant 2 blocks away is excellent and serves late. Quite upmarket - about 90 euro 2 courses and wine for 2, but very nice Catalan simple food. We found Barcelona VERY expensive for food and drinks, even in the residential areas. Make sure you get a T-10 Metro card - gives you 10 journeys for about 7.70 euros, great value as can be used over a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GEGLondon
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Eurostars Angli for 4 nights just after Christmas. The hotel is situated in a smart neighbourhood and a short ride on the metro (Sarria station is a 5-10 min walk from the hotel) from the centre. Our room was exactly as it looked in photos – stylish and modern with a fantastic king size bed and one of the best showers I have ever used! I would reiterate that the transparent glass bathroom may not be suitable for all guests, but it was ok for us. Personally staying outside of the centre was somewhat of a relief and we found it easy to get about everywhere by metro with a T-10 travel card. There’s an El Fornet café on the way to the metro which does fantastic jamon baguettes, pastries & coffee which was perfect for breakfast. There’s also a supermarket, a couple of restaurants and some high end boutique stores in Sarria town itself, although we didn’t really have the time to investigate these. For £61 a night (on Splendia) we though the hotel was an absolute bargain and perfect for anyone who is content to stay outside of Barcelona centre.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Stunning Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin68
Reviews.Content: It's a bit of a trudge uphill from Sarria station with a suitcase (especially as it was raining) but from the first moment you arrive at Eurostars Angli, you know this is something special. I think from a design perspective this is the most stunning hotel I've ever stayed in. Every detail is beautiful and it is done with humour. A particular gem is the Barbie and Action Man dolls encased in plastic boxes on the ground floor toilet doors. Front desk staff were friendly and efficient. Wi-fi wasn't working in the room (Maybe in none of the rooms because another guest came to reception too) but ethernet cables were handed out so no big deal. It's very rare that you go to a hotel and the room looks just like the official photographs but this one did. If you like contemporary design then this is quite wonderful. Bathroom is a little on the small side but perfectly adequate. Shower isn't very powerful. I asked for a room with a hill view and it was wonderful to see the Torre de Collserola (I highly recommend the trip to the viewing observatory BTW). Superbly comfortable bed with a menu of different pillows should you want it. The swimming pool area is very cool and again looks just like the photos. Shame it wasn't the summer... A room service order arrived swiftly and was good quality. Buffet Breakfast was the most disappointing thing about the hotel (compared to how excellent everything else was) and the service wasn't great. It is a bit of a trek (took about 30 mins) from the centre of Barcelona but when you arrive back at the Eurostars Angli, it feels like a little oasis and that's perfectly fine by me. If you're a design junkie and want to escape out of the hussle and bussle of the city then this hotel is a great choice. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MilicaK
Reviews.Content: I and my colleague stayed at Eurostars Angli in Barcelona for 6 nights in April 2008. We liked this hotel very much for its contemporary interior – especially the bathroom! The service was good. You get a bathrobe and slippers. Twice they forgot to bring us new towels but they brought them immediately after we asked them to. The location is indeed a bit far from the city center and its activities, but was very convenient for us since we attended the conference at the nearby University. You need to use public transport to get to the center which is not always the most pleasant thing. The metro is dirty and you don’t feel safe being there – better take a bus or a taxi. The neighborhood is quiet – a high-class residential area with a couple of good restaurants where unfortunately no one speaks English. There is a great café just down the road where we had excellent breakfasts – ask for chorizo-sandwich!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish”
Reviews.Author: Seat11A
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel at a very reasonable price. Loved the shower and full window in bedroom for the morning sun, at least in my room -- remember to keep your shorts on unless you're into this kind of thing..;-). Certainly not in the heart of the city, and a good uphill trek if you're into walking like me, but these are positives traits in my travel book.

Reviews.Title: “little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: lewis_lad
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is more than the word brilliant.Very friendly and informative staff.Situated in a quiet upmarket neighbourhood.A short metro ride will bring you into the hustle and bustle of downtown Barcelona.I personally will return to this hotel on my next trip to this Great City.Book this hotel and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and area”
Reviews.Author: KatieTatie021
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay at the Eurostarts Angli in Sarria Barcelona. This hotel is fantastic. Room was lovely, very stylish and cleaned every day. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful when asked for directions etc. The area of Sarria is lovely. If I went back to Barcelona I would stay here again. The prices of hotels in the city centre are a rip off and it was only six stops on the underground to get to Barcelona city from Sarria and a ticket was only 1 euro 30 cents!! I would recommend going to Bar Thomas for some Patatas Bravas - Don't be put off by the look of the place, it looks like the cafe off eastenders but you have to go to try this tapas dish - they are delicious!!!!! Overall had a fantastic stay, I am going to recommend this hotel to everyone who goes to Barcelona. Happy travels!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool & modern with internet(TV) problems”
Reviews.Author: Sideshore
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in august 2007. A nice hotel, with ok service. Nice modern rooms, cleaning was fine and the pool area also okay, not many people at the hotel while we stayed there. One problem was very anoing: The wireless internet connection didn't work at the room. It did work in the reception and restaurant, but not in the room. The cabel they gave us to solve the problem didn't work and the staff couldn't solve it. Last but not least, to many spanish TV channel. Only CNN and som french stuff isn't good enough. Thomas Denmark

Reviews.Title: “nice design hotel in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: aldomattos
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice design hotel located in a quiet area of Barcelona (Sarriá district). Although it is not in downtown, the closest metro station is reached with a 5-min walk. The rooms are very clean and a gem of interior design. The staff was very kind, but one of the clerks gave us a wrong information about a nearby restaurant: my pregnant wife and I walked to it and it was closed... If you don't like metro, a taxi to Plaza de Catalunya costs around 8-10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday and hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: katielovesdarran
Reviews.Content: What a phenomonal holiday. I cannot WAIT to go back!!!! The hotel was brilliant, not very busy when we were there mostly business people stopping for overnight stays so the poolside was not at all busy for the most part. Only 4 sunloungers but it has grass so when we couldn't get a sun lounger we just put our towels on the ground and sunbathed. BEAUTIFUL LOCATION!!!!!!very affluent area, the room we stayed in over looked 2 huge big villas which had gardeners and maids everyday. the view from our room was just priceless i could have laid in bed all day and just watched the view. Our room looked out onto the big hills where the telecomunication tower is and also there is a big cathedral and some sort of theme park on the hills too because at night around 9 o'clock the cathedral lights up and the big wheel's lights go on,so amazing to just lay in bed while trying to get over to sleep and just watch all the pretty lights. The corridors in the hotel were very fancy, the doors are kind of hidden in the walls and you get a card which you need to put into the door then you hear a click and it pushes inwards into the room. The room itself was very modern and fancy. to operate the lights you have to put your room card into the wall of the door then the air conditioning and lights will be able to work. the air conditioning was quite tricky to work but you can adjust the temprature of it which is good. The blinds at the windows were so cool!the buttons to operate the blinds are by you bedside( and also there are buttons at ur bedside to put all the lights off in the room so you don't need to get up to put off lights you've forgotten about!). there are two blinds- one that has holes in it so that when u have it down people outside can't see in but you can see out then the second blind that is a blackout. you can press a button that puts both down at the same time to save you time at night having to put both down seperately. There is a roof terrace on top of the hotel (although me and my boyfriend who i went with weren't sure if the terrace was private for the one room that has a hot tub in the hotel but whenever we went up no one batted an eye lid). it had the most amazng views you can see for miles and miles i recomend you go up there if ur staying at the hotel!you can even see the sea if you stand at a certain bit!. the room service was very good as well, no troubles ordering it or recieving it and the ingredients were always extremely fresh and tasted really good and healthy. breakfast was EXTREMELY expensive though i wouldn't reccomend it unless you don't have any other choice. there is a supermarket in sarria where we got cans of juice to take back to save us having to buy them from the minibar The Metro station is barely 5 minutes away from the hotel and then is only about 7 minutes if that away from the centre of barcelona and the trains are very very frequent and are never late or delayed. the station is extremely hot though but when you get onto the metro it is air conditioned. we mostly went into the centre of barcelona for meals but there is a pizza hut about 10 mins away from the hotel room and they have no problem with u bringing food back to the hotel or even ordering something for you to be delivered from the hotel. it has a laptop in the foyer that you can use whever you like and it has a really good fast internet connection. all the rooms come with free wifi if im not mistaken but don't take my work on it. safes inside the room are in the wardrobe and is very easy to use but if (like us) you aren't sure how to first work it then if you just call the reception desk they are very helpful. any problems and most of the staff speak good english. there was the odd member of staff who wasn't very helpful and couldn't speak english very well but they were usually always on with another member of staff who could speak english. This was me and my boyfriend's ( we're both 18) first holiday away outside of the uk and we were so happy with it. not at all scary or over whelming. I would deffinitly recomend this hotel for anyone who was thinking of staying in barcelona. the area we stayed in was called Sarria. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Hightech”
Reviews.Author: RY28
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel. The room is as nice and hightech as you get in 5* hotels and is nicely decorated and clean. The barthroom area is separated by a see through glass wall, so while fine for couples may be a problem for some. There is a small swimming pool with a pleasant loan and deckchairs in a nice garden. Unfortunately the hotel is quite a bit of a walk to the underground station and there is nothing much around the hotel. Great place to stay if you get around by taxi but if you walk / use public transport I would suggest staying nearer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mich_cra_holidays
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights starting on 13th July 2007. We found the hotel perfect for what we were looking for. Yes, it is slightly out of town but I think that wherever you stay in Barcelona you will end up getting the metro at some point so this didnt bother us. The closest metro stop was a 10min walk (MAX) and we bought a T10 metro ticket which was excellent value. We also got the open top "bus touristic" which had a stop even closer to the hotel which meant we were able to use it as a mode of transport too. The hotel was very quiet which didnt bother us. We booked without breakfast included which worked out well as we didnt see a single person in the restaurant and the area it is based is famous for its cakes and pastries! The hotel lacked atmosphere but we didnt go to Barcelona to stay in the hotel in the evenings!! I would definately book this hotel, it is clean, modern, with daily maid service. We found that it was such good value compared with the hotels directly in the centre of Barcelona.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Angli
HotelInfo.Address: Angli 60, 08017 Barcelona, Spain
